poem:
### The Reef's Secret Symphony

Descending the blue shaft,
I heard the reef awaken—
chirps, crackles, a strange orchestra.
Blind to coral's palette,
I closed my eyes tight
and let the sounds paint
echoes of hidden worlds,
a symphony
only the depths could play,
composed by a sea
that sings in bubbles and clicks.

As we got closer to the reef, it got louder and louder. It was so weird and different from any other sound I’ve heard. Other scuba divers call it the “crackling” of the coral reef. That’s what". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
